oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Variational Monte Carlo study of a spin one quantum antiferromagnet on a fractal lattice
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GHOSH, DK
WARRIER, LS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: state
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A variational Monte Carlo calculation is made on a spin one Heisenberg antiferromagnet on a fractal lattice. Ground state energy and spin correlation functions are computed for a Sierpinski gasket containing up to 123 sites. The results indicate approximate validity of Marshall sign rule for a tripartite lattice. Correlation functions decay fast with distance, suggesting a disordered ground state.
